intro: Hieracium robustum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are usually heart-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium robustum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its aggressive growth and ability to form dense colonies.
